messages: e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (17:53): I think <foreignObject> should allow anything <body> allows
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (17:53): I don't think allowing <html> makes sense personally
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (17:55): e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0: does allowing anything that body allows work in browsers without a wrapper body or div?
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (17:55): e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0: what about <math>?
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (17:56): if it doesn't that would be buggy
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (17:56): mathml elements need a <math> ancestor to work correctly in firefox, iirc
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (17:56): makes sense
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (17:57): should <math> be allowed as a child of foreignObject without a <p> wrapper?
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (17:57): did CDF ever spec this stuff?
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (17:57): no
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (17:58): they haven't gotten this far yet
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (17:59): e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0: mmkay. I would have thought this was what CDF was supposed to spec since 2004 or so
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (18:00): cdf focused on <object> instead
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (18:00): why would you want to have html in between? it's verbose as it is to embed mathml in svg :)
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (18:00): cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0: <math> is semantically inline
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (18:01): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: ok. then i'd say allow inline html in foreignObject as well :)
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (18:01): yeah, though it's already pretty unclear what "semantically" means in terms of content inside an image
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (18:02): thinks <body> should allow either inline or block
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (18:02): hopes that solves it
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (18:02): the common case for mathml in svg is probably going to be short labels
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (18:03): e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0: would you allow a wrapper <body>, though, like cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 and SVG 1.1 suggest?
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (18:04): probably not
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (18:04): but i guess there's no real harm if it's there anyway...
3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (18:07): "Error: http://www.w3.org/TR/xml-schema-1#src-redefine.6.2.2?ChildContentModelInteractive&rcase-RecurseLax.2" - I wonder if that's bad
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (18:08): And here I thought the Jing RELAX NG messages were bad
3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (18:09): I'm not sure why my lax is recursive
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (18:09): why support XSD?
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (18:11): just tested multiple roots in foreignObject in opera, worked fine
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (18:11): also firefox
3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (18:11): e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0: I want to validate X3D content, and X3D provides XSD and DTD, and everyone hates DTD so I want to make the XSD work :-)
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (18:14): just convert the XSD to a RelaxNG
3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (18:14): Is that trivial?
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (18:14): XSD is relatively hated, too
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (18:15): 3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2, in my XML days I had an XML editor that did it out of the box
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (18:15): forgot the name
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (18:16): finds http://paste.lisp.org/display/21388 which uses <foreignObject><xhtml:img/>
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (18:17): 3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2: a converter is supposedly available from https://msv.dev.java.net/ but the server is misbehaving at the moment
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (18:19): 3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2: https://msv.dev.java.net/files/documents/61/31333/rngconv.20060319.zip
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (18:20): though the truthiness over at wikipedia is that XSD misfeatures are "advantages over RELAX NG"
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (18:20): as if any feature bullet point were an advantage
3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (18:21): rngconv says "warning: unsupported whiteSpace facet is ignored" a lot
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (18:22): http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/XML_Schema_Language_Comparison#Advantages_over_RELAX_NG
3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (18:22): wonders how to try validating with RNG
3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (18:22): Oh, I forgot I've got validator.nu
3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (18:23): "Error: Both operands of interleave contain text.  At line 5680, column 35 in resource http://localhost/.../x3d-3.1.rng"
3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (18:24): Oddly, there is no element named "interleave"
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (18:25): interleave has some mighty annoying restrictions
3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (18:27): If I delete the offending element, I get ten errors like "Conflicting ID-types for attribute USE of element GeoOrigin."
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (18:29): Yeah, that's very annoying. I've considered turning DTD compat off, but I left it on in case someone actually wants it
3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (18:29): thinks this is not entirely trivial, and it seems doubtful that it will match precisely the same documents as the original Schema
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (18:29): moral of the story, if you don't want DTD compat, say xsd:NCName instead of xsd:ID
3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (18:30): Does that mean it can't automatically detect ID/IDREF consistency?
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (18:31): if you use xsd:NCName, then, no
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (18:31): I left DTD Compat on exactly in case someone actually wanted to do ID/IDREF checking in RELAX NG despite it sucking horribly
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (18:32): why does it suck?
3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (18:32): Does xsd:IDREFS map onto something trivial?
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (18:32): 3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2: list { xsd:NCName+ } or something like that. I forget the syntax details
3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (18:33): "Error: Bad value 0 0 0 for attribute centerOfRotation on element Viewpoint from namespace http://www.web3d.org/specifications/x3d-namespace."
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (18:33): cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0: it has the annoying restriction 3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 is seeing
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (18:33): cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0: and it doesn't check that an IDREF points to an element of the right type
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (18:34): cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0: the annoying restriction being that the IDness is applied to an element,attribute pair
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (18:34): cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0: instead of the IDness getting applied to a particular attribute instance when the schema otherwise matches
3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (18:34): attribute centerOfRotation
3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (18:34): xsd:string
3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (18:35): Yay, regexps
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (18:35): the XSD regexps are peculiar
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (18:35): for example, \s is mostly useless
3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (18:35): Looks like line-wrapping in the XSD->RNG converter messed up the whitespace
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (18:35): because it matches anything in Zs
3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (18:36): <xs:restriction base="xs:string">
3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (18:36): <xs:whiteSpace value="collapse"/>
3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (18:36): </xs:restriction>
3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (18:36): is what the XSD says
3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (18:36): which I guess is what "warning: unsupported whiteSpace facet is ignored" means
3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (18:37): is unsure of the least painful solution
3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (18:38): Annoyingly, these patterns are repeated for every attribute in the RNG file
3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (18:38): (whereas it was a single <xs:simpleType name="SFVec3f"> originally)
3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (18:49): goes back to the Schema because that seems less likely to have so many small bugs

3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (18:49): "Error: src-resolve: Cannot resolve the name 'ChildContentModelInteractive_fn3dktizrknc9pi' to a(n) 'type definition' component." - so, uh, where did it get that fn3dktizrknc9pi from?
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (18:52): 3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2: unlike Trang, the Sun converter isn't designed to retain the documentary human-perceived structure of the schema :-(
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (18:52): and Trang doesn't support XSD as an input format
3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (18:55): copies and pastes bits of XSD found on Google until the errors go away
3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (18:58): Ooh, it works
3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (19:05): but I need a Schema for XSLT
3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (19:08): uses the XSLT 2.0 one, because it exists, even though it's probably not what web browsers support
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (19:09): Hixie: do you have a current wild guess about what the XHTML5-in-SVG integration point in foreignObject should look like?
3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (19:12): Hooray, now the validator says my document is valid, except for a few bits which are not valid and need to be redesigned
3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (19:12): I just hope it still says invalid documents are invalid
